posts.post_content:
This is a exemple of how well balancied a Planeswalkers most be.  
  
Not to strong, not to weak, and most have a nice synergy that don't win the game for you, instead, help you to win, alongside with you, as partnership. And that's it, that is what magic is all about.  
  
I am not fan only of the character (she really kickass in the novel), but of her card too, she is just too nice because she is very well balancied. Something that she can be proud of, and something that just a fell Planeswakers have accomplished. =3

posts.post_content: So glad she is getting love from M11. She is a very fun to play, but typically overlooked. She combines a continuous TARGETED discard effect, a top-of-library tutor (which combines wonderfully with jace beleren) and mass rise from the grave. Very black, very flavorful.

posts.post_content:
I think Vess will be back (or even Vess 2.0) in Innistrad's Block. I know it's grasping as straws but they've found a Vess deck (along with others) hidden in DotP 2012's files. Meaning it will probably be unlocked in an expansion (i.e. after or just before the next set). There are also cards we have never seen before in these decks, 2 in Vess' deck. The art and flavor both follow the 'dark' theme of the new set.  
  
Maybe it's just wishful thinking but it all seems to point in that direction. That's just my speculation though.

posts.post_content:
I got the first two booster packs I've got in a while (RoE and M11) and pulled Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre and a holographic Liliana Vess in them, respectively.  
  
Not sure if anyone has pointed this out, but the holographic version is sick. Her eyes and energy around her hands are the most reflective parts of the card and make her look incredibly powerful. I'm already preparing a deck to make the most use of her.  
  
Beautiful card, all around.

Posted By: PcvsApple (8/22/2011 11:55:30 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ehh, first off let me say, I love this card. It is my favorite of the original planeswalkers, and being a player that loves extraction and discard decks, I can truly appreciate a lot of what she has to offer, but her first ability is simply too weak. By any standards. Second ability, better, but the fact she costs 5 and you don't get the card to your hand somewhat sours the party. And her ultimate ability, why are they not dead by the time you use this? The absolute earliest this card can hit the board in standard is turn 3 (if you're ramping with green) and it would take her 4 additional turns to be able to use it. Those are absolutely perfect conditions, and using cards that you will never see in a discard deck. You're also hoping your opponent doesn't take a few swings at her. So no, you will never use that ability with any kind of consistency.  
  
Now I've seen some comments of here say things like "if you can't use her then you're not making a proper discard deck."   
  
Excuse me? Maybe... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
